title: 111_hr5669
content: The text chunk "SECTION 1. PURPOSES AND DEFINITIONS." is a concise statement indicating the beginning of a section that will outline the purposes and definitions of a particular topic. The Act aims to convey approximately 44 acres of federally owned land to the City of Ames, Iowa, and authorize the use of funds for purchasing replacement land and other purposes related to the National Animal Disease Center. The definitions in the Act clarify the terms "City" as the City of Ames, Iowa, and "Property" as the specified land within the National Animal Disease Center. The Act conveys 44 acres of federally owned land to Ames, Iowa, on 13th Street. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Agriculture. The Act conveys 44 acres of federally owned land to Ames, Iowa on 13th Street. The Secretary will convey federal land to the City of Ames, Iowa upon receiving payment equal to the market value of the property. The property will be appraised for its highest and best use before the conveyance. The Interagency Land Acquisition Conference developed Federal Land Acquisitions. The appraisal must be approved by the Secretary and will always belong to the United States. The Secretary can make minor corrections to the property description with the City's agreement. The City is responsible for paying the transaction and administrative costs associated with the conveyance. The Secretary and the City will each bear their own attorneys' fees for the conveyance authorized by the Act. The Secretary must meet disclosure requirements for hazardous substances but is not required to remediate them. Lead-based paint or asbestos-containing building materials are exempt from mitigation or abatement laws. The Secretary is not obligated to mitigate lead-based paint or asbestos-containing building materials on the Property at the time of closing, except for providing notice to the City and obtaining assurance of compliance from them. The City must comply with laws regarding lead-based paint and asbestos-containing materials. The Secretary and the City can agree on additional terms if they align with the Act. The Secretary will deposit funds from the conveyance into the Treasury for the Agricultural Research Service. The funds can be used without further appropriation for land acquisition and related purposes of the National Animal Disease Center. The Act passed by the House of Representatives on July 28, 2010, requires budgetary effects to comply with the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010. The Chairman of the House Budget Committee must submit a statement on the budgetary effects before the vote on passage.
